H0.text: who are considered to be the founding fathers. George Washington

H1.text: who are considered to be the founding fathers. Thomas Jefferson

H2.text: who are considered to be the founding fathers. James Madison

H3.text: who are considered to be the founding fathers. John Jay

A4.text: John Jay was identified by Richard B. Morris as one of the seven key founders based on leadership, longevity, and statesmanship.

A5.text: Thomas Jefferson was a member of the Committee of Five that drafted the Declaration of Independence.

A6.text: George Washington was a Founding Father and the first president of the United States, serving from 1789 to 1797.

A7.text: the delegate Edmund Randolph introduced Madison's Virginia Plan; it called for an entirely new constitution and a sovereign national government, which Washington highly recommended.

A8.text: Jefferson was the primary author of the Declaration of Independence.

A9.text: Jefferson was a leading proponent of democracy, republicanism, and natural rights, and he produced formative documents and decisions at the state, national, and international levels.
